Rulings.Base: 1. [FORUM] As part of the activation requirement of "Rescue Rabbit" (text before the semi-colon), you banish the card. This means that as you activate the effect as Chain Link 1, when your opponent has an opportunity to respond with Chain Link 2, "Rescue Rabbit" is no longer face-up on the field. This means that the opponent is unable to activate "Effect Veiler" as "Rescue Rabbit" is not face-up on the field.\n2. [FORUM] The effect of "Rescue Rabbit" Special Summons both monsters simultaneously. Assuming the monsters are 1500 ATK or higher, the opponent will be able to activate "Bottomless Trap Hole" in response to the successful Special Summon and both monsters would be banished if "Bottomless Trap Hole" successfully resolves.\n3. [FORUM] "Rescue Rabbit" banishes itself from play as part of its cost. "Skill Drain" does not keep a player from activating the effect of his/her face-up Monster, it simply negates the effect of that Monster if the Monster is face-up when its effect resolves. So "Rescue Rabbit" can be activated and will resolve successfully while "Skill Drain" is on the field.

PSCT.Base: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. You can banish this face-up card you control; Special Summon 2 Level 4 or lower Normal Monsters with the same name from your Deck, but destroy them during the End Phase. You can only use this effect of "Rescue Rabbit" once per turn.
